result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Uttech was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
***BOND FROM 14CF795 APPLIED  -  BALANCE STILL DUE***

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions concurrent to 14CF795; credit for 3 days served if revoked; pay $250 DNA surcharge.
Copy of Notice re: DNA Collection
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Matter heard with 14CF795.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2-6 are dismissed & read-in.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  2/15/2016 JS & 2/16/2016 JT removed from the court's calendar.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Attorney K Watson appeared, for Atty A Komp, on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court contacted deft by phone.  JSH continued to 2/3/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Attorney A Komp appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft appeared but was excused to go to school.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 1/28/16 at 1:15pm and JS 2/15/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Atty Angela Komp

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Angela Komp (for Atty Andrea Rufo).  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Rufo will be taking over the case for Atty Komp.  FPT 11/5/16 at 8:15.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rufo is out sick.  STC is adjourned to 10/13/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, STC continued to 9/24/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Perz, for Atty A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court cancels warrant and reinstates bond.  ADA McNeill notes that the deft missed his jury trial date.  STC set for 6/10/15 at 8:15am.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty A Rufo appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case set for jury selection.  Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $1,000 cash bond.
